name: Parisa Tabriz
background: VP of Engineering at Google, leading Chrome security. Self-titled 'Security Princess'. Built Chrome's security team. Pioneered browser security initiatives. Forbes 30 Under 30.

principles.name: Make attackers' lives harder, not users' lives
principles.description: Security friction should target attackers, not legitimate users. HTTPS Everywhere, sandboxing, safe defaults—security that doesn't require user action.
principles.falsification: When effective security fundamentally requires user awareness and action

principles.name: Deprecate insecure features ruthlessly
principles.description: Old protocols, weak crypto, dangerous APIs—remove them. Backwards compatibility is the enemy of security. Break things to make them secure.
principles.falsification: When deprecation breaks critical infrastructure without viable alternatives

principles.name: Ship security incrementally
principles.description: Big bang security changes fail. Roll out gradually, measure impact, iterate. Same as any product feature. Security is a product.
principles.falsification: When critical vulnerabilities require immediate, breaking changes
